# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

def wrap_string(input_str, text_width = 10)
    word_array = input_str.split(" ") # split words based on spaces
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in word_array:
        if (line_length + len(word) > text_width):
            wrapped_text += "\n"
            line_length = 0

        wrapped_text += word + " " # append the word and a space
        line_length += len(word) + 1

    return wrapped_text.strip() # strip any extra spaces or new lines from the end

# Example usage:
input_str = "This is an example string that will be wrapped to a maximum text width of 10 characters."
print("Original String: ", input_str)
wrapped_string = wrap_string(input_str, 10)
print("Wrapped String: ", wrapped_string)
